customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>Prologue: Songs of the Wind</color>
After Barbatos founded his beloved city of Mondstadt, he left it to the care of its first residents and went on his way. Human greed, however, knew no bounds. The rich seized control over the city and ruled it the way they see fit. On the eve of the city's celebrated Ludi Harpastum, a mysterious bard came to the city...
<color=#ffffff>HoYoverse:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/genshin.hoyoverse.com/en/manga/detail/104863?mute=1</color>

Barbatos is the Anemo Archon of Mondstadt. Not to become a tyrant like his predecessor, he left the rule to the people.
Golden Apple Archipelago
Golden Apple Archipelago appeared during Barbatos's Mondstadt terraforming.

customize.name: Decarabian
customize.desc: The God of Storms and the ruler of Old Mondstadt. He was overthrown as a result of an uprising raised by the people of Mondstadt, who could not withstand the tyranny.

customize.text:
The previous ruler of Mondstadt, the God of Storms. After overthrowing Decarabian, Barbatos absorbed his divine power and became the Anemo Archon.
Unknown Bard
Barbatos's friend, with whom they rebelled against Decarabian. After the bard's death, Barbatos took on his appearance.

customize.name: Andrius
customize.desc: The Great Wolf King of the North, a protector of Wolvendom and one of the Four Winds.

customize.text: King of the North Wind who waged a war against Decarabian. When the tyrant was overthrown, Andrius stopped the war and rejected the divine throne and the Archon title.

customize.name: Morax
customize.desc: The Geo Archon of Liyue.

customize.text: The Geo Archon and Barbatos's friend. They are the only original Archons out of seven.

customize.name: Dvalin
customize.desc: An Elemental Dragon and the Anemo Archon Barbatos's friend. After being poisoned by the Shadow Dragon's blood, he became known as Stormterror.

customize.text: An elemental dragon and Barbatos's friend

customize.name: Vennessa
customize.desc: A former slave, the founder and the first Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius, and the Dandelion Knight.

customize.text: A slave of the Mondstadt Lawrence Clan, whom Barbatos helped in order to rebel against the Aristocracy in Mondstadt. She later founded the

customize.name: Knights of Favonius
customize.desc: An order responsible for protecting Mondstadt and its belief of freedom. Despite its members are known as knights, none have been knighted by any royalty — knighthood is a title they earned from the noble duties they assume.

customize.name: Four Winds
customize.desc: The four guardians of Mondstadt, who were summoned a thousand years ago and answer to the Anemo Archon. The Four Winds include the Wolf of the North, the Falcon of the West, the Lion of the South, and the Dragon of the East.

customize.text: , who answer to the Anemo Archon.

customize.name: Venti
customize.desc: One of the many bards of Mondstadt, who freely wanders the city's streets and alleys.

customize.text: Barbatos's mortal persona, a famous Mondstadt bard. To avoid any suspicions, Venti uses a fake

customize.name: Vision
customize.desc: Visions are external magical foci bestowed by Celestia and The Seven upon Allogenes, a small minority of people with strong desires, allowing them to channel a specific elemental power. Every wielder of a Vision is able to attain godhood and ascend to Celestia.

customize.name: La Signora
customize.desc: The Eighth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, also known as The Fair Lady. Her real name is Rosalyne-Kruzchka Lohefalter.

customize.text: The Fatui Harbinger who attacked Barbatos and took his

customize.name: Gnosis
customize.desc: Gnoses are internal magical foci that each of The Seven possesses, allowing them to resonate directly with Celestia itself and serving as an emblem of their status. The Gnoses were created from the remains of the Third Descender.

customize.name: Hexenzirkel
customize.desc: A secret witch society, which discusses secrets at the tea parties and explores Irminsul. There are eight witches in the Hexenzirkel.

customize.text: Once the witches challenged the Anemo Archon, but he suggested making music, not war, and resolving their conflicts through song.

customize.name: Skyward Blade
customize.desc: The sword of a knight that symbolizes the restored honor of Dvalin. The blessings of the Anemo Archon rest on the fuller of the blade, imbuing the sword with the powers of the sky and the wind.

customize.name: Skyward Pride
customize.desc: A claymore that symbolizes the pride of Dvalin soaring through the skies. When swung, it emits a deep hum as the full force of Dvalin's command of the sky and the wind is unleashed.

customize.name: Skyward Atlas
customize.desc: A cloud atlas symbolizing Dvalin and his former master, the Anemo Archon. It details the winds and clouds of the northern regions and contains the powers of the sky and wind.

customize.name: Skyward Harp
customize.desc: A greatbow that symbolizes Dvalin's affiliation with the Anemo Archon. The sound of the bow firing is music to the Anemo Archon's ears. It contains the power of the sky and wind within.

customize.name: Skyward Spine
customize.desc: A polearm that symbolizes Dvalin's firm resolve. The upright shaft of this weapon points towards the heavens, clad in the might of sky and wind.

customize.name: Royal Longsword
customize.desc: An old longsword that belonged to the erstwhile rulers of Mondstadt. Exquisitely crafted, the carvings and embellishments testify to the stature of its owner.

customize.name: Royal Grimoire
customize.desc: A book that once belonged to a court mage of Mondstadt who served the nobility. It contains faithful and comprehensive historical accounts as well as magic spells.

customize.name: Partially Repaired Holy Lyre der Himmel
customize.desc: A treasure that once belonged to Barbatos, the Anemo Archon, with some power restored by a Teardrop Crystal.

customize.name: History of Kings and Clans: Prologue
Along with Divinity: Prologue
customize.desc:
"Have you ever thought about what our lives would've been like without the archons?"
Come and join the author in an exploration of "divinity" with humor and logic.

imgDesc.text: The unknown bard (left) and Barbatos in his true form (right).

desc.text:
The words on this sundial seem to follow on from the one by the Thousand Winds Temple. Taken together, the four lines then deliver the complete message.
This place and the Thousand Winds Temple must have something to do with a god of Time.
How ironic that the ravages of "Time" have devoured all trace of the god who supposedly presided over it...
Also — the literature says that some ancient thinkers believed the Anemo Archon to have some sort of connection with this god...
If that's true, there must be some evidence of that here somewhere... Generally, that would be in the form of <color=#37ffff>elemental</color> evidence...
Also, it definitely feels particularly strange around here at a certain time of the day. Starts around 2 AM, and is over by 5 AM at the latest...
There is this sundial here, after all, and in the early hours of the day <color=#37ffff>the blade's shadow falls directly downwards</color> . It's quite striking, which is why it stands out in my memory.
But I'm no <color=#99ffff>Vision</color> holder. So while I can tell that something's up and theorize about what the cause might be, there's no way for me to investigate it properly.
Honestly, these days... trying to be an academic when you don't have a <color=#37ffff>Vision</color> , it's really restricting...
